caption:
This photograph captures two intricately carved wooden statues near a beach. The statues are symbolic or ritualistic figures, possibly with a cultural or spiritual significance. They are dark in color, likely due to the wood used or weathering effects, and show detailed carvings, featuring human-like forms with expressive faces and elaborate headdresses or hairdos. The statues have a powerful presence, standing upright and facing in different directions, which may suggest a guardian-like role at the location.

The setting of the statues is a sandy beach with dark, volcanic rocks scattered around, typical of oceanic islands with volcanic origins. The ocean is visible in the background, calm with a clear blue sky overhead dotted with light clouds. Also noticeable in the far background, moored in the calm sea, is a small sailboat, adding a hint of human activity and recreation to the otherwise tranquil scene.

The juxtaposition of the ancient, weathered statues against the timeless beauty of the oceanic landscape highlights a connection between the cultural artifacts and the natural environment, possibly indicating the importance of the sea in the cultural or historical context from which these statues originate.
title: Ancient statues in city of refuge national historical park near honaunau on the western side of the island
